sentence.Network_en: We should inure ourselves to hard life.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们应该使自己习惯艰苦生活.

sentence.Network_en: One cannot inure oneself altogether to such malicious criticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 谁也不能总是忍受这种恶意批评.

sentence.Network_en: The inure information reveled, the less profit they can make.
sentence.Network_cn: 信息披露越充分, 潜在投资者的利润越少.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(I3) ... inurbanity 粗野 inure 生效 inurement 生效.
张红岩TOEFL ... intuition n. 直觉 inure v. 使习惯 invade v. 侵入，侵犯.
TOERL单词整理 ... intrude# 侵扰 inure# 使惯于；锻炼 invert# 倒转.
阅读动词_拾墨客_新浪博客 ... Intrigue 吸引人的 inure 使习惯于 Invade 侵入.

list.abs: A decade of Japanese rule had inured Macchurians to most anything ., 经过日本人的十几年统治 , 满洲人对一切已习惯于逆来顺受.
...免费保障(free cover)四，可信度五，内嵌式再保险(inuring reinsurance)本章小结.
one cannot inure oneself altogether to such malicious criticism ., 谁也不能总是忍受这种恶意批评.
We should inure ourselves to hard life ., 我们应该使自己习惯艰苦生活.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English inure, enure, from an Anglo-Norman French phrase meaning 'in use or practice', from en 'in' + Old French euvre 'work' (from Latin opera)

means.word_mean: 1. cause to accept or become hardened to; habituate;

auth_sentence.content: We...must inure ourselves to the sight of grim reality.
auth_sentence.res_content: We...must inure ourselves to the sight of grim reality.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We...must inure ourselves to the sight of grim reality.

auth_sentence.content: No amount of repetition can inure you to these things.
auth_sentence.res_content: No amount of repetition can inure you to these things.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No amount of repetition can inure you to these things.

auth_sentence.content: Phony insults, he hoped, would inure them to real ones.
auth_sentence.res_content: Phony insults, he hoped, would inure them to real ones.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Phony insults, he hoped, would inure them to real ones.

means.word_mean: 使习惯于(令人不快的事物)

sentences.en: The prisoners quickly became inured to the harsh conditions.
sentences.cn: 囚犯们很快就适应了苛刻的条件。
